business.headline: Mid-segment housing: Is it the real core of India's property boom?After years of luxury-led projects, India's real estate developers are refocusing on the mid-segment — a market driven by young professionals, dual-income families, and first-time buyers. But is this segment truly the backbone of India's property boom?

The 'missing' Indian-origin CEO behind Rs 4,200 crore BlackRock loan fraudBankim Brahmbhatt, the Indian-origin CEO of a US-based telecom company, is facing a lawsuit in the US filed by HPS, the private credit investment arm of BlackRock.
Gold and silver shine again after slow start. Will they continue to rise?After a dull opening, both gold and silver managed to regain some shine during the day. Will the upward trend continue?

CBI links Anil Ambani, Rana Kapoor in Rs 2,796-crore Yes Bank loss caseThe CBI has accused industrialist Anil Ambani of approving favours to Yes Bank founder Rana Kapoor's family, causing huge financial losses to the bank. This development highlights alleged corruption and risky investments linked to Ambani's companies.

BlackRock-backed firm accuses Indian-origin entrepreneur of $500 million fraudA US-based telecom entrepreneur of Indian origin, Bankim Brahmbhatt, has been accused of orchestrating a USD 500 million loan fraud involving BlackRock-backed lender HPS Investment Partners.

Sensex, Nifty continue losing streak amid profit booking; BEL jumps 4%The S&P BSE Sensex closed 465.75 points lower at 83,938.71, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 155.75 points to 25,722.10. Selling pressure was broad-based, with most sectoral indices ending in the red.

Lenskart IPO crosses full subscription on Day 1; QIBs drive demandThe IPO opened today and closes on November 4. Lenskart has set a price band of Rs 382 to Rs 402 per share, with a lot size of 37 shares for retail bidders.

Gen Z leads India's crypto investments in Q3 2025: ReportThe 18–25 age group has officially overtaken the 26–35 bracket as the most active investors in crypto. For them, digital assets are no longer a risky experiment — they're becoming part of a serious investment plan.

From Groww to ICICI AMC: Key IPOs to watch this November 2025Bengaluru-based investing platform Groww is set to launch its IPO worth Rs 6,632.3 crore. The issue includes a fresh issue of Rs 1,060 crore and an offer for sale of Rs 5,572.3 crore.

Buying your first house? Check the 5x annual income rule and avoid EMI trapA rising number of first-time buyers are running the affordability math more cautiously. From the 5X income rule to avoiding EMI strain, housing decisions are shifting toward sustainability rather than stretch.

HNI India rebrands as Kokuyo Workplace India, targets leadership in Asia by 2030The rebranding marks a key step in Kokuyo's plan to make India a central hub for its Asia-Pacific operations. The move comes after Kokuyo's acquisition of HNI India earlier this year.

Employees unpaid, control slipping: Bira 91's bad hangoverThe taps are dry, employees unpaid, and investors have taken charge. The question isn't how Bira 91 got here anymore. It's whether it can get out.

Gold loan vs gold overdraft: Which one truly saves you money?Gold loans and gold overdrafts both help unlock the value of your jewellery when you need cash fast. But they don't work the same way — and one could quietly cost you more than you think.

From Aadhaar to bank rules: 7 key financial changes starting November 1As November begins, a fresh set of financial rules will come into effect that could impact your daily money matters. From Aadhaar updates and bank nomination changes to new GST slabs and card fees — here's a quick look at what's changing from November 1.

Air India seeks Rs 10,000 crore lifeline from Tata, SIA after crash: ReportThe request comes at a sensitive moment for the airline, which has been trying to rebuild its reputation, modernise its ageing fleet and streamline operations since being taken over by the Tata Group in 2022.

Meta plans record $30 billion bond sale to stay ahead in AI rcaseThe move comes as Meta signals that its capital expenditure in 2026 will be "notably larger" than next year, underscoring how aggressively it is investing to stay ahead in the AI race.

Lenskart IPO opens: Check GMP, price band, and should you apply?The total issue size is about Rs 7,278 crore, of which roughly Rs 2,150 crore is a fresh issue, while the rest is an offer for sale by existing shareholders.

Gold prices shaky, silver steady. What next for precious metals?Gold is wobbling as the dollar strengthens, while silver holds firm on industrial demand cues. With central banks still buying and the Fed unpredictable, where do precious metals go next?

Sensex, Nifty open flat in volatile trade; NTPC, Cipla among top losersAt around 9:24 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up just 21.15 points at 84,425.61, while the NSE Nifty50 edged higher by 7.35 points to 25,885.20. Broader market indices also hovered marginally higher, mirroring the lack of conviction at the headline level.

entertainment.headline: SRK turns 60: Akshay Kumar to Shilpa Shetty, celebs celebrate superstar's legacy Several celebrities poured in their love for Shah Rukh Khan on his 60th birthday today. They wrote heartfelt messages and celebrated the superstar's legacy.

Shah Bano's family files plea to halt Yami Gautam, Emraan Hashmi's HAQ Shah Bano's family has reportedly filed a petition in Indore High Court seeking an immediate stay on the release of Yami Gautam and Emraan Hashmi's 'HAQ'.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9: Kalai evicted, Vijay Sethupathi schools housemates In the latest episode of 'Bigg Boss Tamil 9', host Vijay Sethupathi schooled the contestant and discussed how the show has become unwatchable because of everyone's behaviour.

King title out: SRK's fiery and ruthless avatar on his 60th birthday Shah Rukh Khan fans are rejoicing as director Siddharth Anand unveiled the title announcement video of their upcoming film 'King' on the superstar's 60th birthday. The movie is set to release in theatres in 2026.

Operation Safed Sagar teaser: Siddharth, Jimmy Shergill bring Kargil war to life The teaser of Netflix's upcoming series 'Operation Safed Sagar' was released on November 2. The show is a key mission carried out by the Indian Air Force (IAF) during the 1999 Kargil War.

BB19 Episode 70: Ashnoor opens up on body-image struggles, says she starved herself In the latest episode of 'Bigg Boss 19's' Weekend Ka Vaar, Salman Khan addressed body-shaming comments made on Ashnoor Kaur and a contentious statement involving Sidharth Shukla. Singing siblings Neha Kakkar and Tony Kakkar also appeared on the show as special guests.

SRK's 60th bash in Alibaug: Farah Khan shares pics, KJo and Rani Mukerji attend Shah Rukh Khan marked his 60th birthday in Alibaug surrounded by friends and family, as colleagues shared glimpses from the celebration. Farah Khan and Karan Johar, among others, shared pictures from the party.

Hrithik Roshan celebrates Saba Azad's 40th birthday with love, poetry and memories Actor Hrithik Roshan shared a series of photos and a poem on social media to celebrate Saba Azad's 40th birthday, offering fans a glimpse into their relationship.

SRK turns 60: Fans from the world over at Mannat for a glimpse in early hours Shah Rukh Khan fans gathered outside his bungalow Mannat in the early hours of his birthday, November 2, 2025, for a glimpse of the superstar.

Happy Birthday SRK: Why the superstar remains Gen Z's favourite loverboy at 60 Gen Z is rediscovering Shah Rukh Khan's classic romantic films, finding comfort and charm in his timeless love stories. From OTT to theatre re-releases, young viewers are celebrating SRK's old-school romance with fresh enthusiasm.

Mahesh Babu, Priyanka Chopra and SS Rajamouli tease fans with SSMB 29 hints Actors Mahesh Babu, Priyanka Chopra, and director SS Rajamouli stirred up curiosity among fans on Saturday with a lively social media conversation about their upcoming film 'SSMB 29'. The team confirmed that an update on the film will be released on November 2.

Shah Rukh Khan plans special fan meet in Bandra for 60th birthday Shah Rukh Khan will hold a special gathering for his fans on November 2 at Balgandharva Rangmandir in Mumbai's Bandra. The event will only be open to those holding passes distributed through his fan clubs.

Mahhi Vij reacts to divorce rumours, trashes talk of Rs 5 crore alimony demand Actor Mahhi Vij broke her silence on speculation around her marriage with Jay Bhanushali in a recent YouTube video. She also clarified the Rs 5 crore alimony rumours and appealed for privacy.

SRK birthday: Manish Malhotra wishes actor; Farah, Karan, others head to Alibaug The countdown to Shah Rukh Khan's birthday has begun. On Saturday, fashion designer Manish Malhotra shared birthday wishes for King Khan. Farah Khan, Karan Johar and Navya Naveli Nanda, amongst others, on the other hand, headed to Alibaug for celebrations.

The White House Effect review: When climate science became political fictionRelease Date:Fri Oct 31, 2025 The archival documentary, 'The White House Effect', exposes how political promises turned climate science into policy fiction. A sobering universal lesson: since world leaders lack accountability, the future of the global village now rests squarely on the compass of personal responsibility.

Lokesh Kanagaraj turns actor, romances Wamiqa Gabbi in DC. Watch teaser Tamil director Lokesh Kanagaraj is set to make his acting debut in the film 'DC', which pairs him opposite Wamiqa Gabbi. The film is directed by Arun Matheswaran and produced by Sun Pictures.

Anees Bazmee confirms Bhool Bhulaiyaa 4 with Kartik Aaryan is in works Filmmaker Anees Bazmee shared that 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 4' is in the works. He also confirmed in a recent interview that actor Kartik Aaryan would lead the next instalment.

One year of Singham Again: Arjun Kapoor celebrates love for Danger Lanka Actor Arjun Kapoor reflected on his experience playing Danger Lanka in 'Singham Again' as the film completed a year of release. He expressed his gratitude to director Rohit Shetty, the cast, and the audience with a special post.

Janhvi Kapoor turns Achiyyamma for Ram Charan's Peddi. Poster out The first look poster of Janhvi Kapoor from the much-anticipated film 'Peddi' has been released. The film, directed by Buchi Babu Sana and featuring Ram Charan, is set for release on March 27, 2026.

general news.headline: Satyamev Jayate: Anant Singh's 1st reaction after arrest in Mokama murder caseAnant Singh was arrested early Sunday in connection with the murder of Dularchand Yadav. His lawyer claims the arrest is politically motivated and aimed at influencing the Mokama elections.

Katta, cruelty, corruption: PM Modi blames RJD's 'jungle raj' for Bihar's ruinPrime Minister Narendra Modi criticised the Grand Alliance manifesto, calling it a bundle of lies. He promised one crore jobs and projected a strong NDA win in the upcoming Bihar assembly polls.

PM does yoga for votes, Adani and Ambani dance after polls: Rahul Gandhi's digAddressing a rally in Bihar's Begusarai, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi claimed PM Narendra Modi does not listen to the people and "vanishes" after elections.

Chef investing for daughter's studies scammed. His Rs 38-lakh lesson for allJust a Facebook like by Chef Sumit Kumar got him defrauded of Rs 38 lakh through an investment impersonation scam. In the last 6 months, 30,000 people across major cities in India lost over Rs 1,500 crore to investment scams. Here's how people are losing money and how you can keep yours safe.

Will continue to hunt and kill: US after 3 dead in latest 'drug boat' strikesThe US military conducted a lethal strike on a drug trafficking vessel in the Caribbean, killing three men. The operation has sparked international criticism and raised concerns over legality.

Called Kumbh faltu: BJP shreds Lalu Yadav over Halloween video with grandchildrenVideos of RJD chief Lalu Yadav celebrating Halloween with his grandchildren have surfaced online, drawing criticism from the BJP. The party pointed to Yadav's previous remark about the Maha Kumbh Mela as 'faltu' (meaningless).

Maha jungle raj: Tejashwi Yadav jabs PM after Anant Singh arrested in murder caseReacting to the arrest of gangster-politician Anant Singh in Jan Suraaj supporter Dular Chand Yadav's murder, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav slammed PM Narendra Modi, alleging there was a 'maha jungle raj' in Bihar.

Happy Birthday SRK: Why the superstar remains Gen Z's favourite loverboy at 60Gen Z is rediscovering Shah Rukh Khan's classic romantic films, finding comfort and charm in his timeless love stories. From OTT to theatre re-releases, young viewers are celebrating SRK's old-school romance with fresh enthusiasm.

Vreels: A Game-Changing Platform Pushing Social Media Beyond TikTok and InstagramVreels isn't just about sharing, it's about connecting meaningfully. Through built-in chat, voice, and video call features, users can communicate without leaving the app.

Delhi air quality slips to very poor zone again, shallow fog drops visibilityAir quality in Delhi worsened sharply as the Air Quality Index was 373, which fell in the 'very poor' category on Sunday. Several areas recorded 'severe' air quality levels, with Wazirpur being the worst affected.

Blinkit customer recalls delivery agent arriving in tears over deduction after complaintIn a now-viral post on Reddit, a user recalled how a Blinkit delivery agent arrived at their door in tears after a missing-item complaint led to a deduction from his earnings.

LVM3 can't launch a 4.4 tonne satellite: How Isro's Bahubali will do itThis mission marks a significant milestone in India's space program, showcasing advancements in satellite technology and launch capabilities while addressing critical defense needs.

Tried to crush us: Manoj Tiwari says RJD supporters attacked him at Bihar rallyBJP MP Manoj Tiwari has claimed he was attacked and heckled by RJD supporters during a roadshow in Bihar's Dumraon. Bihar. He accused the RJD of indulging in thuggery as the Assembly polls draw close.

At least 23, including children, killed in massive explosion at Mexico supermarketMost of the deaths appeared to have been from inhalation of toxic gases, said Gustavo Salas, the state's attorney general, citing its forensic medical service.

We slept on floor: Indian women's team 1st captain recalls struggles of the pastFormer India women's cricket team captain Shantha Rangaswamy recalled the difficult days. She said that the Indian women's team had to earlier sleep on the floor and carry their own bedding.

King title out: SRK's fiery and ruthless avatar on his 60th birthdayShah Rukh Khan fans are rejoicing as director Siddharth Anand unveiled the title announcement video of their upcoming film 'King' on the superstar's 60th birthday. The movie is set to release in theatres in 2026.

Kane Williamson retires from T20Is, to continue playing ODIs and TestsNew Zealand great Kane Williamson decided to call time on his T20I career on November 2. A long-time captain of the Blackcaps, Williamson will continue to play the ODIs and Test cricket.

Pak issues naval warning as India begins tri-services exercise near Sir CreekThe move follows Islamabad's recent Notice to Airmen (NOTAM), restricting several air routes across central and southern Pakistan from October 28-29.

2 arrested for stabbing passengers on UK train, 9 suffer critical injuriesNine people were stabbed and critically injured on a train near Cambridge, prompting an armed police response and the arrest of two men at Huntingdon station.

India's teachers are burning out, and students are paying the priceTeachers carry emotional and academic load round the clock, leading to burnout that affects classrooms and student wellbeing. Experts say student mental health cannot improve without supporting teachers and involving parents. India needs better support systems, training, and recognition to protect educators.

Beat up vote thieves: Thackeray cousins protest against poll roll irregularitiesUddhav Thackeray has urged voters to confront vote thieves amid alleged electoral roll irregularities in Maharashtra. Opposition leaders demand postponement of civic polls until voter lists are cleaned up.

Shah Bano's family files plea to halt Yami Gautam, Emraan Hashmi's HAQShah Bano's family has reportedly filed a petition in Indore High Court seeking an immediate stay on the release of Yami Gautam and Emraan Hashmi's 'HAQ'.

3rd T20I Preview: Team selection under scrutiny ahead of Hobart gameIndia vs Australia: Suryakumar Yadav's side heads to Hobart with several questions surrounding the team selection. Is Shivam Dube really needed? What exactly is Sanju Samson's position in this line-up? India will have plenty to answer on Sunday.

sports.headline: Rishabh Pant hits 90 on red-ball comeback, carries India to 3-wicket win Rishabh Pant's sparkling 90 formed the backbone of India A's hard-fought three-wicket win over South Africa A in the first four-day match on Sunday at the BCCI Centre of Excellence Grounds.

Women's World Cup: Kanpur fans rally behind Team India ahead of final As the Indian women's cricket team prepares for the ICC Women's World Cup final against South Africa, excitement fills the air in Kanpur. Fans gather with flags and chants, expressing their faith in the team's form and spirit.

Heart vs Mind: Gavaskar's tense prediction for India's historic World Cup final vs South Africa On this India Today Special Report, the focus is on the Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 final between India and South Africa, with legendary cricketer Sunil Gavaskar sharing his expert analysis. My heart says India, but my mind says to me, you know that, don't forget that the South African men's team won the world championship... so 2025 is a year which has been good for South Africa in cricket,' Gavaskar commented on the tense final. The discussion delves deep into crucial factors like the toss, weather conditions in Navi Mumbai, and the strategic dilemmas facing the Indian team. Gavaskar weighs in on the playing XI, backing the explosive Shafali Verma to open the innings, and analyzes the bowling combination, highlighting the pros and cons of different spinners against a powerful South African batting lineup. The report captures the excitement around a historic final that will crown a first-time world champion.

World Cup Final Drama: Rain Threatens India's Historic Title Clash With South Africa In Navi Mumbai This special report from India Today focuses on the Women's Cricket World Cup final between India and South Africa at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai, where unpredictable weather threatens to disrupt the historic match. A fan on the ground noted, 'The good thing that we have 2 new teams in the final, India and South Africa. Something different than every time we see Australia or England, so. Yes, it is going to be a. Great contest'. The coverage captures the immense excitement among fans, with correspondent Khushi Gupta speaking to locals and the dedicated Bharat Army fan group. Key figures like Indian captain Harmanpreet Kaur and South African star Marizanne Kapp are central to the contest. Despite the looming rain, which has been intermittent, supporters remain hopeful of seeing India clinch its maiden World Cup title on home soil, creating a tense and electrifying atmosphere.

Watch: Deepti Sharma's mother wants heart on sleeves from India in World Cup final IND vs SA, Women's World Cup final: India all-rounder Deepti Sharma's mother sent a motivational message to the entire ODI side, amping them up to play with their utmost passion in the Women's World Cup final against South Africa in Navi Mumbai on November 2.

3rd T20I: Arshdeep Singh replaces Harshit Rana as India make three changes India have made a few changes for the third T20I against Australia in Hobart, with Arshdeep Singh returning to the XI in place of Harshit Rana. Jitesh Sharma takes over the wicketkeeping duties from Sanju Samson, while Washington Sundar comes in for Kuldeep Yadav.

Watch: South Africa President's inspiring message ahead of World Cup final vs India Women's World Cup final: South Africa President Cyril Ramaphosa shared an inspiring message for the Proteas Women ahead of their ODI World Cup final clash against India in Cape Town.

Watch: India stars send heartfelt wishes to team ahead of ODI World Cup final vs SA As India gear up for the Women's ODI World Cup final against South Africa, their teammates not in the ODI squad made sure to wish the side luck. From Shreyanka Patil to Poonam Yadav, heartfelt wishes poured in for the big night in Navi Mumbai.

Women's World Cup Final Live: Toss delayed further due to heavy rain IND vs SA Live Score, Women's World Cup 2025 Final: Rain returns once again in Navi Mumbai. DY Patil has been put under covers again and the toss is likely to be delayed further. There is a two-hour layoff added to this match.

The Super Sunday is hers: A final that could change women's cricket forever Women's World Cup final: On a morning when chai stalls hum with talk of Harmanpreet and Smriti instead of Virat and Rohit, India stands at the edge of something rare. Tonight's result may decide not just a title, but the future of women's cricket in India and the world beyond.

Watch: South Africa President's inspiring message ahead of World Cup final vs India Women's World Cup final: South Africa President Cyril Ramaphosa shared an inspiring message for the Proteas Women ahead of their ODI World Cup final clash against India in Cape Town.

From Shreyanka Patil to Poonam Yadav, heartfelt wishes poured in for the big night in Navi Mumbai.

Women's World Cup Final Live: Toss delayed further due to heavy rain IND vs SA Live Score, Women's World Cup 2025 Final: Rain returns once again in Navi Mumbai. DY Patil has been put under covers again and the toss is likely to be delayed further. There is a two-hour layoff added to this match.

Tonight's result may decide not just a title, but the future of women's cricket in India and the world beyond.

We slept on floor: Indian women's team 1st captain recalls struggles of the pastFormer India women's cricket team captain Shantha Rangaswamy recalled the difficult days. She said that the Indian women's team had to earlier sleep on the floor and carry their own bedding.

Fourth time lucky? India's mental battle to end the World Cup heartbreakIndia are all set to play their fourth final of an ICC event as they take on South Africa in the Women's World Cup 2025 final. The Harmanpreet Kaur-led side face a daunting task of rising above their past heartbreaks to taste the World Cup glory.

Harmanpreet Kaur: Moga's daughter one step away from cricketing immortalityIndia vs South Africa, Women's World Cup: Harmanpreet Kaur stands one step away from cricketing immortality as Indian women's cricket chases a watershed moment that could mirror the men's historic 1983 triumph. On Sunday at the DY Patil Stadium, her team will take on a formidable South Africa, determined to end the country's long wait for an ICC trophy.

India vs South Africa, Women's World Cup 2025 Final: Key matchups to look out forIndia and South Africa face off for a maiden World Cup title in Navi Mumbai. Mandhana vs Kapp, Mlaba vs Rodrigues, Richa vs de Klerk — five duels, one night, and a shot at rewriting history.

Kane Williamson retires from T20Is, to continue playing ODIs and TestsNew Zealand great Kane Williamson decided to call time on his T20I career on November 2. A long-time captain of the Blackcaps, Williamson will continue to play the ODIs and Test cricket.

India a step away from epic moment as Women's World Cup set for new championWomen's World Cup 2025, IND vs SA: India will be aiming to end their long wait for an ICC title when they face a strong South African side on Sunday at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai. While India stunned seven-time champions Australia in the semifinals, the Proteas thrashed England by 125 runs to book their place in the final.

Babar Azam returns to form as Pakistan clinch T20I series vs South AfricaBabar Azam roared back to form with a sublime 68 off 47 balls as Pakistan beat South Africa by four wickets in Lahore to clinch the T20I series 2–1. Shaheen Shah Afridi and debutant Usman Tariq starred with the ball, restricting South Africa to 139/9 before Pakistan sealed victory with six balls to spare.

Be fearless: Gambhir and co rally behind India's women's team before World Cup finalThe Indian men's team, including Gautam Gambhir, Suryakumar Yadav and Jasprit Bumrah, sent their best wishes to Harmanpreet Kaur's side ahead of the Women's World Cup final, urging them to stay fearless and enjoy the occasion in Navi Mumbai.

While India stunned seven-time champions Australia in the semifinals, the Proteas thrashed England by 125 runs to book their place in the final.

Shaheen Shah Afridi and debutant Usman Tariq starred with the ball, restricting South Africa to 139/9 before Pakistan sealed victory with six balls to spare.

Be fearless: Gambhir and co rally behind India's women's team before World Cup finalThe Indian men's team, including Gautam Gambhir, Suryakumar Yadav and Jasprit Bumrah, sent their best wishes to Harmanpreet Kaur's side ahead of the Women's World Cup final, urging them to stay fearless and enjoy the occasion in Navi Mumbai.

Amad Diallo's late volley earns Manchester United a 2-2 draw vs Nottingham ForestAmad Diallo's late volley salvaged a 2-2 draw for Manchester United at Nottingham Forest after Casemiro's opener was overturned by two quick goals. The equaliser saved United's unbeaten run but denied them the chance to climb higher in the Premier League table.

Najmul Hossain Shanto makes dramatic U-turn, returns as Bangladesh Test captainNajmul Hossain Shanto has made a surprise return as Bangladesh's Test captain, just months after stepping down, with the BCB reinstating him to lead through the 2025–27 World Test Championship cycle.

3rd T20I Preview: Team selection under scrutiny ahead of Hobart gameIndia vs Australia: Suryakumar Yadav's side heads to Hobart with several questions surrounding the team selection. Is Shivam Dube really needed? What exactly is Sanju Samson's position in this line-up? India will have plenty to answer on Sunday.

India under a lot of pressure as they are expected to win: Laura WolvaardtWomen's World Cup, IND vs SA: In the pre-match press conference, South Africa skipper Laura Wolvaardt said that India are expected to win the final and hence, they will be under pressure to perform at the Dr DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

Fans furious as Women's World Cup final tickets get sold out before sale announcementFans were left outraged after tickets for the ICC Women's World Cup Final were marked "Sold Out" on BookMyShow before any official sale announcement, prompting criticism of BCCI and organisers over poor communication and lack of transparency.

Laura Wolvaardt gives Pat Cummins vibes, wants to silence India crowd in finalSkipper Laura Wolvaardt said South Africa will look to silence the Indian fans when they face India in the Women's World Cup 2025 final in Navi Mumbai. Confident after their semi-final win over England, Wolvaardt said her team will start afresh in the grand finale.

Women's World Cup Final Predicted XI: Can India nail their winning combination?India and South Africa face off in a high-stakes Women's World Cup Final, with both teams expected to stick to their winning XIs. Harmanpreet Kaur remains tight-lipped on team selection as both captains eye a historic finish to a thrilling tournament.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
